1   Moreover the Domina answered Job, and said: 2 Shall she that reproveth contend with the Almighty? She that argueth with God, let her answer it.

 3   Then Job answered the Domina, and said: 4 Behold, I am of small account; what shall I answer Thee? I lay my hand upon my mouth. 5 Once have I spoken, but I will not answer again; yea, twice, but I will proceed no further.

 6 Then the Domina answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said: 7 Gird up thy loins now like a woman; I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto Me. 8 Wilt thou even make void My judgment? Wilt thou condemn Me, that thou mayest be justified? 9 Or hast thou an arm like God? And canst thou thunder with a voice like Her? 10 Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency, and array thyself with glory and beauty. 11 Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath; and look upon every one that is proud, and abase her. 12 Look on every one that is proud, and bring her low; and tread down the wicked in their place. 13 Hide them in the dust together; bind their faces in the hidden place. 14 Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee. 15 Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; she eateth grass as an ox. 16 Lo now, her strength is in her loins, and her force is in the stays of her body.
17 She straineth her tail like a cedar; the sinews of her thighs are knit together. 18 Her bones are as pipes of brass; her gristles are like bars of iron. 19 She is the beginning of the ways of God; She only that made her can make Her sword to approach unto her. 20 Surely the mountains bring her forth food, and all the beasts of the field play there. 21 She lieth under the lotus-trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens. 22 The lotus-trees cover her with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass her about. 23 Behold, if a river overflow, she trembleth not; she is confident, though the Jordan rush forth to her mouth. 24 Shall any take her by her eyes, or pierce through her nose with a snare? 25 Canst thou draw out leviathan with a fish-hook? or press down her tongue with a cord? 26 Canst thou put a ring into her nose? or bore her jaw through with a hook? 27 Will she make many supplications unto thee? or will she speak soft words unto thee? 28 Will she make a covenant with thee, that thou shouldest take her for a servant for ever? 29 Wilt thou play with her as with a bird? Or wilt thou bind her for thy manservants? 30 Will the bands of fisherwomen make a banquet of her? Will they part her among the merchants? 31 Canst thou fill her skin with barbed irons? or her head with fish-spears? 32 Lay thy hand upon her; think upon the battle, thou wilt do so no more.
